page.title: 11Bradley, Best Kept Village.
page.content: The Best Kept Village competition was started in 1956.It aims to encourage people to work together and to be proud of their village.The competition is sponsored by Staffs. brewers and is organised by the Community Council. It is held during the Summer months.Judges visit the villages several times.Marks are given for tidiness,care and community effort.The general cleanliness and tidiness of churchyards litter bins,grass verges etc. are taken into consideration. In Bradley groups of people are responsible for looking after different parts of the village. The children paint posters [which are put up around the village] to remind people to keep the village tidy. They also keep the school and playingfield tidy.The winning village recieves the A.G.B.Owen trophy. Bradley has won 6 times in the Small Village class.
